title: Can you sell your acc without breaking any of the rules.
body: Would love to just quit the game but I've spent so much money into it and just dropped 30 dollars. Is there anyway of getting the money I've put into it back (via selling the acc or any other way)?

replies.body: Account selling is against the terms of use.
Thanks for the feedback. Looks like I'm sticking to league for a while then.

As *Lew and Wolfess* mentioned, account selling or sharing of **any kind** is against the [*Terms of Use*.](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/legal/termsofuse)

As for refunds, once you've purchased RP, it cannot be refunded, as per our [*refund policy*](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751864-Content-Refund-FAQ). Let me know if you have any other questions.

What actions exactly could Riot take against someone who quit the game?

Just asking, because I never hear of someone sued for account sharing.

Any sort of letting anyone else play on an account made by someone else is against the rules, including buying, selling, and sharing.

there's no way to get your money back, same as with all online games. You paid for an exchange from real money into riot points, and that's what you got. Whatever you spent said Riot points on or whatever you decided to do or not do with them is irrelevant. It's probably better to just take a break from the game and leave your account until maybe one day you feel bored and decide you wish to try a hand at it again or notice there's an update that really catches your attention, like a new champ or big change in the game.
